subject: Re: [PATCH v1] mm: zswap: add per-memcg stat for incompressible pages

reviews.author: Nhat Pham
reviews.summary: Reviewer Nhat Pham agrees with the patch, finding it useful for multi-tenant setups and suggesting potential extensions to zswap. He also provides some minor suggestions for improvement.

reviews.author: Shakeel Butt
reviews.summary: The reviewer, Shakeel Butt, found the patch mostly good but suggested a few changes, including updating the documentation and renaming the 'zswpraw' stat to something like 'INCOMPRESSIBLE' or 'INCOMP'.

reviews.author: Yosry Ahmed
reviews.summary: Reviewer Yosry Ahmed suggested renaming several functions to better reflect their purpose and also proposed dropping a helper function due to potential confusion.

reviews.author: Jiayuan Chen (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer Jiayuan Chen raised concerns about the correctness of using a helper function zswap_is_incomp() in mm/memcontrol.c, suggesting it would be semantically incorrect and instead proposed to use dlen == PAGE_SIZE to verify decompression output.

reviews.author: SeongJae Park
reviews.summary: Reviewer SeongJae Park raised concerns about the documentation of a new stat and suggested improvements to the helper function zswap_is_raw(). They also questioned the naming convention of the function, suggesting alternative names such as zswap_compression_failed() or zswap_was_incompressible().
